    Team News

    Arsenal
    • Arsene Wenger isn't expected to spring any surprises in selection, with the likes of Danny Welbeck and Theo Walcott having to settle for a spot on the bench.
    • Tomas Rosicky, Jack Wilshere, Mikel Arteta and Santi Cazorla are still unavailable.
    Barcelona
    • Luis Enrique will select his strongest XI for the trip to London, with Ivan Rakitic favourite to start ahead of Arda Turan.
    • Marc-Andre ter Stegen will come back in between the sticks.

    Prediction

    • Arsenal will face off against the reigning European champions for the first time since the 2010/11 campaign.
    • Barcelona are 32 games unbeaten in all competitions.
    • The Gunners haven't reached the quarter finals stage of the Champions League for six years and their wait is likely to be prolonged this season.
    • Neymar, Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez have scored 81 goals across all competitions this season, 20 more goals than Arsenal have managed as a team across the four competitions they have been involved in this season.
